description.narrative: The Human Rights Technical Coopeation (HRTC) Program was established in 1998 following the inaugural Australia-China Human Rights Dialogue (HRD) in 1997. The Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) is the Australian implementing partner, with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) the implementing partner in China. The program was re-designed in 2012 to sharpen focus and improve effectiveness, and resulted in the 2012-16 phase , increasing opportunities for strategic engagement and collaboration between Chinese and Australian agencies. An Independent Evaluation of the 2012-16 program was conducted by an independent team in April 2016. Overall, the evaluation team concluded that HRTC is an important and effective element of Australia’s human rights engagement with China. It brings a positive, practical and constructive approach to Australia and China’s broader engagement on human rights. The evaluation team has made a range of recommendations to inform the design of the new phase of HR
